description: Number of distinct minimal unary DFA's with exactly n states.
references: Cyril Nicaud, Average state complexity of operations on unary automata, Math. Foundations of Computer Science, 1999, Lect. Notes in Computer Sci. #1672, pp. 231-240
Jeffrey Shallit, Notes on Enumeration of Finite Automata, manuscript, Jan 30, 2001
formula: psi(n)+sum(psi(n-j)*2^(j-1), j=1..n-1), where psi(n) is number of primitive words of length n over a 2-letter alphabet (expressible in terms of the Moebius function).
example: a(1) = 2 because there are exactly two minimal unary automata with 1 state.
prog: (PARI) mypsi(n) = sumdiv(n, d, moebius(n/d)*2^d) /* from A027375 */a(n) = mypsi(n) + sum(j=1, n-1, mypsi(n-j)*2^(j-1)) \\ _Michel Marcus_, May 25 2013
author: _Jeffrey Shallit_, Jan 30 2001
